title: NASA Accelerates SLS Rocket Hot Fire Test, Invites Media to Pretest Briefing
content: Following a test readiness review on Monday, NASA is now targeting Saturday, Jan. 16, for the final test in the Green Run testing series for the core stage of the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket that will launch the agency’s Artemis I mission.
contentSnippet: Following a test readiness review on Monday, NASA is now targeting Saturday, Jan. 16, for the final test in the Green Run testing series for the core stage of the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket that will launch the agency’s Artemis I mission.

title: NASA Highlights Astrophysics Missions at ‘Super Bowl of Astronomy’
content: Experts from across NASA will discuss topics ranging from black holes to exploding stars to planets beyond our solar system at the 237th meeting of the American Astronomical Society (AAS).
contentSnippet: Experts from across NASA will discuss topics ranging from black holes to exploding stars to planets beyond our solar system at the 237th meeting of the American Astronomical Society (AAS).

title: NASA, FAA Partnership Bolsters American Commercial Space Activities
content: NASA and the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) signed a new memorandum of understanding (MOU) reaffirming the agencies’ longstanding relationship to foster robust American commercial space transportation capabilities, including commercial crew and cargo activities.
contentSnippet: NASA and the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) signed a new memorandum of understanding (MOU) reaffirming the agencies’ longstanding relationship to foster robust American commercial space transportation capabilities, including commercial crew and cargo activities.

title: NASA, NSF Sign Agreement to Advance Space, Earth, Biological, Physical Sciences
content: NASA and the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) have signed a memorandum of understanding affirming the agencies’ intent to continue their longstanding partnership in mutually beneficial research activities advancing space, Earth, biological, and physical sciences to further U.S. national space policy and promote the progress of science.
contentSnippet: NASA and the U.S. National Science Foundation (NSF) have signed a memorandum of understanding affirming the agencies’ intent to continue their longstanding partnership in mutually beneficial research activities advancing space, Earth, biological, and physical sciences to further U.S. national space policy and promote the progress of science.

title: NASA Astronauts Aboard Space Station to Answer Questions from STEM Students
content: Students from across the country will have an opportunity this week to ask questions of NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
contentSnippet: Students from across the country will have an opportunity this week to ask questions of NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: NASA Highlights Innovation, Technology at Virtual SciTech Forum
content: Experts from across NASA will participate in the 2021 American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) SciTech Forum beginning Monday, Jan. 11.
contentSnippet: Experts from across NASA will participate in the 2021 American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) SciTech Forum beginning Monday, Jan. 11.

title: NASA to Air Departure of Upgraded SpaceX Cargo Dragon from Space Station
content: The SpaceX Dragon that arrived to the International Space Station on the company’s 21st resupply services mission for NASA is scheduled to depart on Monday, Jan. 11, loaded with 5,200 pounds of scientific experiments and other cargo.
contentSnippet: The SpaceX Dragon that arrived to the International Space Station on the company’s 21st resupply services mission for NASA is scheduled to depart on Monday, Jan. 11, loaded with 5,200 pounds of scientific experiments and other cargo.

title: NASA Approves Heliophysics Missions to Explore Sun, Earth’s Aurora
content: NASA has approved two heliophysics missions to explore the Sun and the system that drives space weather near Earth.
contentSnippet: NASA has approved two heliophysics missions to explore the Sun and the system that drives space weather near Earth.

title: NASA Television to Air Departure of Northrop Grumman’s Cygnus from Space Station
content: Northrop Grumman’s uncrewed Cygnus spacecraft is scheduled to depart the International Space Station on Wednesday, Jan. 6, more than three months after delivering nearly 8,000 pounds of supplies, scientific investigations, commercial products, hardware, and other cargo to the orbiting outpost.
contentSnippet: Northrop Grumman’s uncrewed Cygnus spacecraft is scheduled to depart the International Space Station on Wednesday, Jan. 6, more than three months after delivering nearly 8,000 pounds of supplies, scientific investigations, commercial products, hardware, and other cargo to the orbiting outpost.

title: Young Students Send Questions to Astronauts Aboard Space Station
content: Students from across the country will have an opportunity this week to hear from a NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
contentSnippet: Students from across the country will have an opportunity this week to hear from a NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
